title.rendered: Do You Ever Wish You Didn’t Have Report Footers?

content.rendered:
Don’t you just hate when you export your report from Salesforce and start analyzing your data; you, insert table, add a pivot table, and then you realize… you forgot to delete the footer.  UGG! Now you need to find the rows in you data and delete them. But how many are there? Where are they?  

BLEH!  You don’t need this stress, so don’t let it happen. Remove the disclaimer footer from your report exports as default, and never worry about finding the rows in your data again.

How?

Setup – Customize – Reports & Dashboards – Reports and Dashboards  Settings

Then check the “Exclude Disclaimer from Exported Reports” checkbox and save. 

Anyone have any other tricks to share?

excerpt.rendered:
Don’t you just hate when you export your report from Salesforce and start analyzing your data; you, insert table, add a pivot table, and then you realize… you forgot to delete the footer. UGG!
You don’t need this stress, so don’t let it happen. Remove the disclaimer footer from your report exports as default, and never worry about finding the rows in your data again.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Jumping on the Clean up Bandwagon
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: "Clean up, clean up, every Admin everywhere clean up, clean up every Admin do your share..." OK, enough chanting of songs by purple dinosaurs.  So everyone is talking about cleaning the org for a fresh start to 2015, but I don't feel like we are really digging into the horrible…

jetpack-related-posts.title: Salesforce Documentation and User Help
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Greetings Post Readers, I told you I would be back to let you know about Org Documentation and Help Sites so here I am. When it comes to org documentation I have to tell you, mine is either SO BEYOND THROUGH that it would kill many trees to print, OR…

jetpack-related-posts.title: Backing Up Your Org
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: How to backup your org's data and metadata, and what to do when a crazy-random-happenstance happens, like data loss.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Field Break-ups
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Are you two just not working out? Has he been lying to you with bad data? Or have you just out grown each other? No matter what the reason, things have to end. It's ok, not all fields are meant to be in Salesforce forever. Don't rip that bandaid just…

jetpack-related-posts.title: Save Yourself Some Time & Increase Report Type Usability
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Custom report types can be your BFF, helping you report on things you never thought you could in Salesforce, but you need to take the time to increase their usability. It only takes one, then you can clone... :-)

jetpack-related-posts.title: Tools & Tricks with Extensions & HotKeys for a Bit o’ Magic in your Toolkit
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Sometimes, there are just too many clicks to get where you need to go, and the last thing you need is more stress.  You're an admin, you love your job, but a lot of people depend on you and there is a lot you need to get done and never enough time to…
